children.name: along
children.description: Takes a LineString and returns a Point at a specified distance along the line.

returns.desc: Point  distance   units  along the line

options.Description: can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers

children.name: area
children.description: Takes one or more features and returns their area in square meters.
children.snippet:
var polygon = turf.polygon([[[125, -15], [113, -22], [154, -27], [144, -15], [125, -15]]]);

var area = turf.area(polygon);

children.name: bbox
children.description: Takes a set of features, calculates the bbox of all input features, and returns a bounding box.

returns.desc: bbox extent in  minX, minY, maxX, maxY  order

children.name: bboxPolygon
children.description: Takes a bbox and returns an equivalent polygon.
children.snippet:
var bbox = [0, 0, 10, 10];

var poly = turf.bboxPolygon(bbox);

returns.desc: a Polygon representation of the bounding box

params.Description: extent in  minX, minY, maxX, maxY  order

options.Description: Translate properties to Polygon
Translate Id to Polygon

children.name: bearing
children.description: Takes two points and finds the geographic bearing between them, i.e. the angle measured in degrees from the north line (0 degrees)

returns.desc: bearing in decimal degrees, between -180 and 180 degrees (positive clockwise)

options.Description: calculates the final bearing if true

children.name: center
children.description: Takes a Feature or FeatureCollection and returns the absolute center point of all features.

returns.desc: a Point feature at the absolute center point of all input features

options.Description: Translate GeoJSON Properties to Point
Translate GeoJSON BBox to Point
Translate GeoJSON Id to Point

children.name: centerOfMass
children.description: Takes any Feature or a FeatureCollection and returns its center of mass using this formula: Centroid of Polygon.
children.snippet:
var polygon = turf.polygon([[[-81, 41], [-88, 36], [-84, 31], [-80, 33], [-77, 39], [-81, 41]]]);

var center = turf.centerOfMass(polygon);

options.Description: Translate Properties to Feature

children.name: centroid
children.description:
Takes one or more features and calculates the centroid using the mean of all vertices.
This lessens the effect of small islands and artifacts when calculating the centroid of a set of polygons.
children.snippet:
var polygon = turf.polygon([[[-81, 41], [-88, 36], [-84, 31], [-80, 33], [-77, 39], [-81, 41]]]);

var centroid = turf.centroid(polygon);

returns.desc: the centroid of the input features

options.Description: an Object that is used as the

children.name: destination
children.description: Takes a Point and calculates the location of a destination point given a distance in degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers; and bearing in degrees. This uses the Haversine formula to account for global curvature.

options.Description: miles, kilometers, degrees, or radians
Translate properties to Point

children.name: distance
children.description: Calculates the distance between two points in degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers. This uses the Haversine formula to account for global curvature.

options.Description: can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers

children.name: envelope
children.description: Takes any number of features and returns a rectangular Polygon that encompasses all vertices.

returns.desc: a rectangular Polygon feature that encompasses all vertices

children.name: length
children.description: Takes a GeoJSON and measures its length in the specified units, (Multi)Point 's distance are ignored.
children.snippet:
var line = turf.lineString([[115, -32], [131, -22], [143, -25], [150, -34]]);
var length = turf.length(line, {units: 'miles'});

options.Description: can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers

children.name: midpoint
children.description: Takes two points and returns a point midway between them. The midpoint is calculated geodesically, meaning the curvature of the earth is taken into account.

returns.desc: a point midway between  pt1  and  pt2

children.name: pointOnFeature
children.description: Takes a Feature or FeatureCollection and returns a Point guaranteed to be on the surface of the feature.

returns.desc: a point on the surface of  input

children.name: polygonTangents
children.description: Finds the tangents of a (Multi)Polygon from a Point.

returns.desc: Feature Collection containing the two tangent points

params.Description: to calculate the tangent points from

children.name: pointToLineDistance
children.description: Returns the minimum distance between a Point and a LineString , being the distance from a line the minimum distance between the point and any segment of the LineString.

options.Description:
can be anything supported by turf/convertLength
(ex: degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers)

wether to calculate the distance based on geodesic (spheroid) or
planar (flat) method. Valid options are 'geodesic' or 'planar'.

children.name: rhumbBearing
children.description: Takes two points and finds the bearing angle between them along a Rhumb line i.e. the angle measured in degrees start the north line (0 degrees)

returns.desc: bearing from north in decimal degrees, between -180 and 180 degrees (positive clockwise)

options.Description: calculates the final bearing if true

children.name: rhumbDestination
children.description: Returns the destination Point having travelled the given distance along a Rhumb line from the origin Point with the (varant) given bearing.

params.Description: varant bearing angle ranging from -180 to 180 degrees from north

options.Description: can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers
translate properties to destination point

children.name: rhumbDistance
children.description: Calculates the distance along a rhumb line between two points in degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers.

options.Description: can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers

children.name: square
children.description:
Takes a bounding box and calculates the minimum square bounding box that
would contain the input.
children.snippet:
var bbox = [-20, -20, -15, 0];
var squared = turf.square(bbox);

params.Description: extent in  west, south, east, north  order

children.name: greatCircle
children.description: Calculate great circles routes as LineString or MultiLineString. If the start and end points span the antimeridian, the resulting feature will be split into a MultiLineString .

options.Description: line feature properties
number of points

offset controls the likelyhood that lines will
be split which cross the dateline. The higher the number the more likely.

children.name: cleanCoords
children.description: Removes redundant coordinates from any GeoJSON Geometry.

options.Description: allows GeoJSON input to be mutated

children.name: flip
children.description: Takes input features and flips all of their coordinates from  [x, y]  to  [y, x].
children.snippet:
var serbia = turf.point([20.566406, 43.421008]);

var saudiArabia = turf.flip(serbia);

returns.desc: a feature or set of features of the same type as  input  with flipped coordinates

options.Description: allows GeoJSON input to be mutated (significant performance increase if true)

children.name: rewind
children.description: Rewind (Multi)LineString or (Multi)Polygon outer ring counterclockwise and inner rings clockwise (Uses Shoelace Formula ).
children.snippet:
var polygon = turf.polygon([[[121, -29], [138, -29], [138, -18], [121, -18], [121, -29]]]);

var rewind = turf.rewind(polygon);

options.Description: enable reverse winding
allows GeoJSON input to be mutated (significant performance increase if true)

children.name: round
children.description: Round number to precision

children.name: truncate
children.description: Takes a GeoJSON Feature or FeatureCollection and truncates the precision of the geometry.

params.Description: any GeoJSON Feature, FeatureCollection, Geometry or GeometryCollection.

options.Description: coordinate decimal precision
maximum number of coordinates (primarly used to remove z coordinates)
allows GeoJSON input to be mutated (significant performance increase if true)

children.name: bboxClip
children.description: Takes a Feature and a bbox and clips the feature to the bbox using lineclip. May result in degenerate edges when clipping Polygons.

params.Description: feature to clip to the bbox
extent in  minX, minY, maxX, maxY  order

children.name: bezierSpline
children.description:
Takes a  line  and returns a curved version
by applying a  Bezier spline 
algorithm.

options.Description: Translate properties to output
time in milliseconds between points
a measure of how curvy the path should be between splines

children.name: buffer
children.description: Calculates a buffer for input features for a given radius. Units supported are miles, kilometers, and degrees.
children.snippet:
var point = turf.point([-90.548630, 14.616599]);
var buffered = turf.buffer(point, 500, {units: 'miles'});

params.Description: distance to draw the buffer (negative values are allowed)

options.Description: any of the options supported by turf units
number of steps

children.name: circle
children.description: Takes a Point and calculates the circle polygon given a radius in degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers; and steps for precision.

options.Description: number of steps
miles, kilometers, degrees, or radians
properties

children.name: clone
children.description:
Returns a cloned copy of the passed GeoJSON Object, including possible 'Foreign Members'.
~3-5x faster than the common JSON.parse + JSON.stringify combo method.
children.snippet:
var line = turf.lineString([[-74, 40], [-78, 42], [-82, 35]], {color: 'red'});

var lineCloned = turf.clone(line);
children.example:
var line = turf.lineString([[-74, 40], [-78, 42], [-82, 35]], {color: 'red'});

var lineCloned = turf.clone(line);

children.name: concave
children.description: Takes a set of points and returns a concave hull Polygon or MultiPolygon. Internally, this uses turf-tin to generate geometries.

returns.desc: a concave hull (null value is returned if unable to compute hull)

options.Description:
the length (in 'units') of an edge necessary for part of the
hull to become concave.
can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers

children.name: convex
children.description: Takes a Feature or a FeatureCollection and returns a convex hull Polygon.

options.Description: 1 - thin shape. Infinity - convex hull.
Translate Properties to Feature

children.name: difference
children.description: Finds the difference between two polygons by clipping the second polygon from the first.

returns.desc: a Polygon or MultiPolygon feature showing the area of  polygon1  excluding the area of  polygon2  (if empty returns  null )

params.Description: Polygon feature to difference from polygon1

children.name: dissolve
children.description: Dissolves a FeatureCollection of polygon features, filtered by an optional property name:value. Note that mulitpolygon features within the collection are not supported

returns.desc: a FeatureCollection containing the dissolved polygons

params.Description: input feature collection to be dissolved

options.Description: features with the same

children.name: intersect
children.description: Takes two polygon or multi-polygon geometries and finds their polygonal intersection. If they don't intersect, returns null.

returns.desc: returns a feature representing the area they share (either a Polygon or MultiPolygon ). If they do not share any area, returns null.

options.Description: Translate GeoJSON Properties to Feature

children.name: lineOffset
children.description: Takes a  line  and returns a  line  at offset by the specified distance.
children.snippet:
var line = turf.lineString([[-83, 30], [-84, 36], [-78, 41]], { "stroke": "#F00" });

var offsetLine = turf.lineOffset(line, 2, {units: 'miles'});

returns.desc: Line offset from the input line

params.Description: distance to offset the line (can be of negative value)

options.Description: can be degrees, radians, miles, kilometers, inches, yards, meters

children.name: polygonSmooth
children.description: Smooths a Polygon or MultiPolygon. Based on Chaikin's algorithm . Warning: may create degenerate polygons.
children.snippet:
var polygon = turf.polygon([[[11, 0], [22, 4], [31, 0], [31, 11], [21, 15], [11, 11], [11, 0]]]);

var smoothed = turf.polygonSmooth(polygon, {iterations: 3})

options.Description: THe number of times to smooth the polygon. A higher value means a smoother polygon.

children.name: simplify
children.description: Takes a GeoJSON object and returns a simplified version. Internally uses simplify-js to perform simplification using the Ramer-Douglas-Peucker algorithm.

options.Description: simplification tolerance
whether or not to spend more time to create a higher-quality simplification with a different algorithm
allows GeoJSON input to be mutated (significant performance increase if true)

children.name: tesselate
children.description:
Tesselates a  Feature<Polygon>  into a  FeatureCollection<Polygon>  of triangles
using  earcut.
children.snippet:
var poly = turf.polygon([[[11, 0], [22, 4], [31, 0], [31, 11], [21, 15], [11, 11], [11, 0]]]);
var triangles = turf.tesselate(poly);

children.name: transformRotate
children.description: Rotates any geojson Feature or Geometry of a specified angle, around its  centroid  or a given  pivot  point.

params.Description: of rotation in decimal degrees, positive clockwise

options.Description: point around which the rotation will be performed
allows GeoJSON input to be mutated (significant performance increase if true)

children.name: transformTranslate
children.description:
Moves any geojson Feature or Geometry of a specified distance along a Rhumb Line
on the provided direction angle.
children.snippet:
var poly = turf.polygon([[[0,29],[3.5,29],[2.5,32],[0,29]]]);
var translatedPoly = turf.transformTranslate(poly, 100, 35);

params.Description: length of the motion; negative values determine motion in opposite direction
of the motion; angle from North in decimal degrees, positive clockwise

options.Description: in which
length of the vertical motion, same unit of distance
allows GeoJSON input to be mutated (significant performance increase if true)

children.name: transformScale
children.description:
Scale a GeoJSON from a given point by a factor of scaling (ex: factor=2 would make the GeoJSON 200% larger).
If a FeatureCollection is provided, the origin point will be calculated based on each individual Feature.
children.snippet:
var poly = turf.polygon([[[0,29],[3.5,29],[2.5,32],[0,29]]]);
var scaledPoly = turf.transformScale(poly, 3);

params.Description: of scaling, positive or negative values greater than 0

options.Description: Point from which the scaling will occur (string options: sw/se/nw/ne/center/centroid)
allows GeoJSON input to be mutated (significant performance increase if true)

children.name: union
children.description: Takes two (Multi)Polygon(s) and returns a combined polygon. If the input polygons are not contiguous, this function returns a MultiPolygon feature.

returns.desc: a combined Polygon or MultiPolygon feature, or null if the inputs are empty

params.Description: Polygon feature to difference from polygon1

options.Description: Translate Properties to output Feature

children.name: voronoi
children.description:
Takes a FeatureCollection of points, and a bounding box, and returns a FeatureCollection
of Voronoi polygons.

returns.desc: a set of polygons, one per input point.

params.Description: to find the Voronoi polygons around.

options.Description: clipping rectangle, in

children.name: combine
children.description: Combines a FeatureCollection of Point , LineString , or Polygon features into MultiPoint , MultiLineString , or MultiPolygon features.

returns.desc: a FeatureCollection of corresponding type to input

children.name: explode
children.description: Takes a feature or set of features and returns all positions as points.
children.snippet:
var polygon = turf.polygon([[[-81, 41], [-88, 36], [-84, 31], [-80, 33], [-77, 39], [-81, 41]]]);

var explode = turf.explode(polygon);

returns.desc: points representing the exploded input features

throws.desc: if it encounters an unknown geometry type

children.name: flatten
children.description: Flattens any GeoJSON to a FeatureCollection inspired by geojson-flatten.

returns.desc: all Multi-Geometries are flattened into single Features

children.name: lineToPolygon
children.description: Converts (Multi)LineString(s) to Polygon(s).
children.snippet:
var line = turf.lineString([[125, -30], [145, -30], [145, -20], [125, -20], [125, -30]]);

var polygon = turf.lineToPolygon(line);

options.Description: translates GeoJSON properties to Feature
auto complete linestrings (matches first & last coordinates)
sorts linestrings to place outer ring at the first position of the coordinates
mutate the original linestring using autoComplete (matches first & last coordinates)

children.name: polygonize
children.description: Polygonizes (Multi)LineString(s) into Polygons.

children.name: polygonToLine
children.description: Converts a Polygon to (Multi)LineString or MultiPolygon to a FeatureCollection of (Multi)LineString.
children.snippet:
var poly = turf.polygon([[[125, -30], [145, -30], [145, -20], [125, -20], [125, -30]]]);

var line = turf.polygonToLine(poly);

options.Description: translates GeoJSON properties to Feature

children.name: ellipse
children.description: Takes a Point and calculates the ellipse polygon given two semi-axes expressed in variable units and steps for precision.

params.Description: semi (major) axis of the ellipse along the x-axis
semi (minor) axis of the ellipse along the y-axis

options.Description: angle of rotation in decimal degrees, positive clockwise
point around which the rotation will be performed
number of steps
unit of measurement for axes
properties

children.name: kinks
children.description: Takes a linestring , multi-linestring , multi-polygon or polygon and returns points at all self-intersections.

children.name: lineArc
children.description:
Creates a circular arc, of a circle of the given radius and center point, between bearing1 and bearing2;
0 bearing is North of center point, positive clockwise.

params.Description: angle, in decimal degrees, of the first radius of the arc
angle, in decimal degrees, of the second radius of the arc

options.Description: number of steps
miles, kilometers, degrees, or radians

children.name: lineChunk
children.description: Divides a LineString into chunks of a specified length. If the line is shorter than the segment length then the original line is returned.
children.snippet:
var line = turf.lineString([[-95, 40], [-93, 45], [-85, 50]]);

var chunk = turf.lineChunk(line, 15, {units: 'miles'});

params.Description: how long to make each segment

options.Description: units can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers
reverses coordinates to start the first chunked segment at the end

children.name: lineIntersect
children.description: Takes any LineString or Polygon GeoJSON and returns the intersecting point(s).

children.name: lineOverlap
children.description: Takes any LineString or Polygon and returns the overlapping lines between both features.

returns.desc: lines(s) that are overlapping between both features

params.Type: (Geometry|Feature <(LineString|MultiLineString|Polygon|MultiPolygon)>)
(Geometry|Feature <(LineString|MultiLineString|Polygon|MultiPolygon)>)

options.Description: Tolerance distance to match overlapping line segments (in kilometers)

children.name: lineSegment
children.description: Creates a FeatureCollection of 2-vertex LineString segments from a (Multi)LineString or (Multi)Polygon.
children.snippet:
var polygon = turf.polygon([[[-50, 5], [-40, -10], [-50, -10], [-40, 5], [-50, 5]]]);
var segments = turf.lineSegment(polygon);

children.name: lineSlice
children.description: Takes a line , a start Point , and a stop point and returns a subsection of the line in-between those points. The start & stop points don't need to fall exactly on the line.

children.name: lineSliceAlong
children.description: Takes a line , a specified distance along the line to a start Point , and a specified distance along the line to a stop point and returns a subsection of the line in-between those points.

params.Description: distance along the line to starting point
distance along the line to ending point

options.Description: can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers

children.name: lineSplit
children.description: Split a LineString by another GeoJSON Feature.

children.name: mask
children.description: Takes any type of polygon and an optional mask and returns a polygon exterior ring with holes.

params.Description: GeoJSON Polygon used as interior rings or holes.
GeoJSON Polygon used as the exterior ring (if undefined, the world extent is used)

children.name: nearestPointOnLine
children.description: Takes a Point and a LineString and calculates the closest Point on the (Multi)LineString.

returns.desc: closest point on the  line  to  point. The properties object will contain three values:  index : closest point was found on nth line part,  dist : distance between pt and the closest point,  location : distance along the line between start and the closest point.

options.Description: can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers

children.name: sector
children.description: Creates a circular sector of a circle of given radius and center Point , between (clockwise) bearing1 and bearing2; 0 bearing is North of center point, positive clockwise.

params.Description: angle, in decimal degrees, of the first radius of the sector
angle, in decimal degrees, of the second radius of the sector

options.Description: miles, kilometers, degrees, or radians
number of steps
Translate properties to Feature Polygon

children.name: shortestPath
children.description: Returns the shortest path from start to end without colliding with any Feature in obstacles

returns.desc: shortest path between start and end

options.Description: areas which path cannot travel
minimum distance between shortest path and obstacles
unit in which resolution & minimum distance will be expressed in; it can be degrees, radians, miles, kilometers, ...
distance between matrix points on which the path will be calculated

children.name: unkinkPolygon
children.description:
Takes a kinked polygon and returns a feature collection of polygons that have no kinks.
Uses  simplepolygon  internally.
children.snippet:
var poly = turf.polygon([[[0, 0], [2, 0], [0, 2], [2, 2], [0, 0]]]);

var result = turf.unkinkPolygon(poly);

children.name: featureCollection
children.description: Takes one or more Features and creates a FeatureCollection.

options.Description: Bounding Box Array
Identifier associated with the Feature

children.name: feature
children.description: Wraps a GeoJSON Geometry in a GeoJSON Feature.

params.Description: an Object of key-value pairs to add as properties

options.Description: Bounding Box Array
Identifier associated with the Feature

children.name: geometryCollection
children.description:
Creates a  Feature<GeometryCollection>  based on a
coordinate array. Properties can be added optionally.

params.Description: an Object of key-value pairs to add as properties

options.Description: Bounding Box Array
Identifier associated with the Feature

children.name: lineString
children.description: Creates a LineString Feature from an Array of Positions.

params.Description: an Object of key-value pairs to add as properties

options.Description: Bounding Box Array
Identifier associated with the Feature

children.name: multiLineString
children.description:
Creates a  Feature<MultiLineString>  based on a
coordinate array. Properties can be added optionally.
children.snippet:
var multiLine = turf.multiLineString([[[0,0],[10,10]]]);

//=multiLine
children.example:
var multiLine = turf.multiLineString([[[0,0],[10,10]]]);

//=multiLine

params.Description: an Object of key-value pairs to add as properties

options.Description: Bounding Box Array
Identifier associated with the Feature

children.name: multiPoint
children.description:
Creates a  Feature<MultiPoint>  based on a
coordinate array. Properties can be added optionally.
children.snippet:
var multiPt = turf.multiPoint([[0,0],[10,10]]);

//=multiPt
children.example:
var multiPt = turf.multiPoint([[0,0],[10,10]]);

//=multiPt

params.Description: an Object of key-value pairs to add as properties

options.Description: Bounding Box Array
Identifier associated with the Feature

children.name: multiPolygon
children.description:
Creates a  Feature<MultiPolygon>  based on a
coordinate array. Properties can be added optionally.
children.snippet:
var multiPoly = turf.multiPolygon([[[[0,0],[0,10],[10,10],[10,0],[0,0]]]]);

//=multiPoly
children.example:
var multiPoly = turf.multiPolygon([[[[0,0],[0,10],[10,10],[10,0],[0,0]]]]);

//=multiPoly

params.Description: an Object of key-value pairs to add as properties

options.Description: Bounding Box Array
Identifier associated with the Feature

children.name: point
children.description: Creates a Point Feature from a Position.
children.snippet:
var point = turf.point([-75.343, 39.984]);

//=point
children.example:
var point = turf.point([-75.343, 39.984]);

//=point

params.Description: longitude, latitude position (each in decimal degrees)
an Object of key-value pairs to add as properties

options.Description: Bounding Box Array
Identifier associated with the Feature

children.name: polygon
children.description: Creates a Polygon Feature from an Array of LinearRings.

params.Description: an Object of key-value pairs to add as properties

options.Description: Bounding Box Array
Identifier associated with the Feature

children.name: randomPosition
children.description: Returns a random position within a  box.
children.snippet:
var position = turf.randomPosition([-180, -90, 180, 90])
// => position
children.example:
var position = turf.randomPosition([-180, -90, 180, 90])
// => position

params.Description: a bounding box inside of which positions are placed.

children.name: randomPoint
children.description: Returns a random point.
children.snippet:
var points = turf.randomPoint(25, {bbox: [-180, -90, 180, 90]})
// => points
children.example:
var points = turf.randomPoint(25, {bbox: [-180, -90, 180, 90]})
// => points

params.Description: how many geometries will be generated

options.Description: a bounding box inside of which geometries are placed.

children.name: randomLineString
children.description: Returns a random linestring.
children.snippet:
var lineStrings = turf.randomLineString(25, {bbox: [-180, -90, 180, 90]})
// => lineStrings
children.example:
var lineStrings = turf.randomLineString(25, {bbox: [-180, -90, 180, 90]})
// => lineStrings

params.Description: how many geometries will be generated

options.Description: a bounding box inside of which geometries are placed.
is how many coordinates each LineString will contain.

is the maximum number of decimal degrees that a
vertex can be from its predecessor

is the maximum number of radians that a
line segment can turn from the previous segment.

children.name: randomPolygon
children.description: Returns a random polygon.
children.snippet:
var polygons = turf.randomPolygon(25, {bbox: [-180, -90, 180, 90]})
// => polygons
children.example:
var polygons = turf.randomPolygon(25, {bbox: [-180, -90, 180, 90]})
// => polygons

params.Description: how many geometries will be generated

options.Description: a bounding box inside of which geometries are placed.
is how many coordinates each LineString will contain.

is the maximum number of decimal degrees latitude or longitude that a
vertex can reach out of the center of the Polygon.

children.name: sample
children.description: Takes a FeatureCollection and returns a FeatureCollection with given number of features at random.
children.snippet:
var points = turf.randomPoint(100, {bbox: [-80, 30, -60, 60]});

var sample = turf.sample(points, 5);

children.name: interpolate
children.description: Takes a set of points and estimates their 'property' values on a grid using the  Inverse Distance Weighting (IDW) method.

returns.desc: grid of points or polygons with interpolated 'property'

params.Description: the distance across each grid point

options.Description: defines the output format based on a Grid Type (options: 'square' | 'point' | 'hex' | 'triangle')
the property name in
used in calculating cellSize, can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers
exponent regulating the distance-decay weighting

children.name: isobands
children.description: Takes a square or rectangular grid FeatureCollection of Point features with z-values and an array of value breaks and generates filled contour isobands.

returns.desc: a FeatureCollection of MultiPolygon features representing isobands

params.Description: input points - must be square or rectangular

options.Description: the property name in
GeoJSON properties passed to ALL isobands
GeoJSON properties passed, in order, to the correspondent isoband (order defined by breaks)

children.name: isolines
children.description: Takes a grid FeatureCollection of Point features with z-values and an array of value breaks and generates isolines.

returns.desc: a FeatureCollection of MultiLineString features representing isolines

params.Description: values of  zProperty  where to draw isolines

options.Description: the property name in
GeoJSON properties passed to ALL isolines

GeoJSON properties passed, in order, to the correspondent isoline;
the breaks array will define the order in which the isolines are created

children.name: planepoint
children.description: Takes a triangular plane as a Polygon and a Point within that triangle and returns the z-value at that point. The Polygon should have properties a , b , and c that define the values at its three corners. Alternatively, the z-values of each triangle point can be provided by their respective 3rd coordinate if their values are not provided as properties.

params.Description: the Point for which a z-value will be calculated
a Polygon feature with three vertices

children.name: tin
children.description: Takes a set of points and creates a Triangulated Irregular Network , or a TIN for short, returned as a collection of Polygons. These are often used for developing elevation contour maps or stepped heat visualizations.

params.Description:
name of the property from which to pull z values
This is optional: if not given, then there will be no extra data added to the derived triangles.

children.name: pointsWithinPolygon
children.description: Finds Points or MultiPoint coordinate positions that fall within (Multi)Polygon(s).

returns.desc: Point(s) or MultiPoint(s) with positions that land within at least one polygon.  The geometry type will match what was passsed in

params.Description: Point(s) or MultiPoint(s) as input search
(Multi)Polygon(s) to check if points are within

children.name: tag
children.description: Takes a set of points and a set of polygons and/or multipolygons and performs a spatial join.

returns.desc: points with  containingPolyId  property containing values from  polyId

params.Description: property in  polygons  to add to joined { <Point> } features
property in  points  in which to store joined property from  polygons

children.name: hexGrid
children.description: Takes a bounding box and the diameter of the cell and returns a FeatureCollection of flat-topped hexagons or triangles ( Polygon features) aligned in an "odd-q" vertical grid as described in Hexagonal Grids.

params.Description: extent in  minX, minY, maxX, maxY  order

length of the side of the the hexagons or triangles, in units. It will also coincide with the
radius of the circumcircle of the hexagons.

options.Description: used in calculating cell size, can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers
passed to each hexagon or triangle of the grid
if passed a Polygon or MultiPolygon, the grid Points will be created only inside it
whether to return as triangles instead of hexagons

children.name: pointGrid
children.description: Creates a Point grid from a bounding box, FeatureCollection or Feature.

params.Description: extent in  minX, minY, maxX, maxY  order
the distance between points, in units

options.Description: used in calculating cellSide, can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers
if passed a Polygon or MultiPolygon, the grid Points will be created only inside it
passed to each point of the grid

children.name: squareGrid
children.description: Creates a square grid from a bounding box.

params.Description: extent in  minX, minY, maxX, maxY  order

options.Description:
used in calculating cellSide, can be degrees,
radians, miles, or kilometers

if passed a Polygon or MultiPolygon,
the grid Points will be created only inside it
passed to each point of the grid

children.name: triangleGrid
children.description: Takes a bounding box and a cell depth and returns a set of triangular polygons in a grid.

params.Description: extent in  minX, minY, maxX, maxY  order

options.Description: used in calculating cellSide, can be degrees, radians, miles, or kilometers
if passed a Polygon or MultiPolygon, the grid Points will be created only inside it
passed to each point of the grid

children.name: nearestPoint
children.description: Takes a reference point and a FeatureCollection of Features with Point geometries and returns the point from the FeatureCollection closest to the reference. This calculation is geodesic.

returns.desc: the closest point in the set to the reference point

children.name: collect
children.description:
Merges a specified property from a FeatureCollection of points into a
FeatureCollection of polygons. Given an  inProperty  on points and an  outProperty 
for polygons, this finds every point that lies within each polygon, collects the
 inProperty  values from those points, and adds them as an array to  outProperty 
on the polygon.

returns.desc: polygons with properties listed based on  outField

params.Description: polygons with values on which to aggregate

children.name: clustersDbscan
children.description: Takes a set of points and partition them into clusters according to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DBSCAN data clustering algorithm.

returns.desc: Clustered Points with an additional two properties associated to each Feature:

params.Description: Maximum Distance between any point of the cluster to generate the clusters (kilometers only)

options.Description: in which
Allows GeoJSON input to be mutated

Minimum number of points to generate a single cluster,
points which do not meet this requirement will be classified as an 'edge' or 'noise'.

children.name: clustersKmeans
children.description: Takes a set of points and partition them into clusters using the k-mean. It uses the k-means algorithm

returns.desc: Clustered Points with an additional two properties associated to each Feature:

options.Description: numberOfClusters that will be generated
allows GeoJSON input to be mutated (significant performance increase if true)

children.name: coordAll
children.description: Get all coordinates from any GeoJSON object.

children.name: coordEach
children.description: Iterate over coordinates in any GeoJSON object, similar to Array.forEach()

params.Description: a method that takes (currentCoord, coordIndex, featureIndex, multiFeatureIndex)
whether or not to include the final coordinate of LinearRings that wraps the ring in its iteration.

children.name: coordReduce
children.description: Reduce coordinates in any GeoJSON object, similar to Array.reduce()

returns.desc: The value that results from the reduction.

params.Description: a method that takes (previousValue, currentCoord, coordIndex)
Value to use as the first argument to the first call of the callback.
whether or not to include the final coordinate of LinearRings that wraps the ring in its iteration.

children.name: featureEach
children.description:
Iterate over features in any GeoJSON object, similar to
Array.forEach.

children.name: featureReduce
children.description: Reduce features in any GeoJSON object, similar to Array.reduce().

returns.desc: The value that results from the reduction.

params.Description: a method that takes (previousValue, currentFeature, featureIndex)
Value to use as the first argument to the first call of the callback.

children.name: flattenEach
children.description:
Iterate over flattened features in any GeoJSON object, similar to
Array.forEach.

params.Description: a method that takes (currentFeature, featureIndex, multiFeatureIndex)

children.name: flattenReduce
children.description: Reduce flattened features in any GeoJSON object, similar to Array.reduce().

returns.desc: The value that results from the reduction.

params.Description: a method that takes (previousValue, currentFeature, featureIndex, multiFeatureIndex)
Value to use as the first argument to the first call of the callback.

children.name: getCoord
children.description: Unwrap a coordinate from a Point Feature, Geometry or a single coordinate.

params.Description: GeoJSON Point or an Array of numbers

children.name: getCoords
children.description: Unwrap coordinates from a Feature, Geometry Object or an Array

params.Description: Feature, Geometry Object or an Array

children.name: getGeom
children.description: Get Geometry from Feature or Geometry Object

throws.desc: if geojson is not a Feature or Geometry Object

children.name: getType
children.description: Get GeoJSON object's type, Geometry type is prioritize.

params.Description: name of the variable to display in error message (unused)

children.name: geomEach
children.description: Iterate over each geometry in any GeoJSON object, similar to Array.forEach()

params.Description: a method that takes (currentGeometry, featureIndex, featureProperties, featureBBox, featureId)

children.name: geomReduce
children.description: Reduce geometry in any GeoJSON object, similar to Array.reduce().

returns.desc: The value that results from the reduction.

params.Description: a method that takes (previousValue, currentGeometry, featureIndex, featureProperties, featureBBox, featureId)
Value to use as the first argument to the first call of the callback.

children.name: propEach
children.description: Iterate over properties in any GeoJSON object, similar to Array.forEach()

children.name: propReduce
children.description:
Reduce properties in any GeoJSON object into a single value,
similar to how Array.reduce works. However, in this case we lazily run
the reduction, so an array of all properties is unnecessary.

returns.desc: The value that results from the reduction.

params.Description: a method that takes (previousValue, currentProperties, featureIndex)
Value to use as the first argument to the first call of the callback.

children.name: segmentEach
children.description:
Iterate over 2-vertex line segment in any GeoJSON object, similar to Array.forEach()
(Multi)Point geometries do not contain segments therefore they are ignored during this operation.

params.Description: a method that takes (currentSegment, featureIndex, multiFeatureIndex, geometryIndex, segmentIndex)

children.name: segmentReduce
children.description:
Reduce 2-vertex line segment in any GeoJSON object, similar to Array.reduce()
(Multi)Point geometries do not contain segments therefore they are ignored during this operation.

params.Description: a method that takes (previousValue, currentSegment, currentIndex)
Value to use as the first argument to the first call of the callback.

children.name: getCluster
children.description: Get Cluster

returns.desc: Single Cluster filtered by GeoJSON Properties

params.Description: Filter used on GeoJSON properties to get Cluster

children.name: clusterEach
children.description: clusterEach

params.Description: GeoJSON property key/value used to create clusters
a method that takes (cluster, clusterValue, currentIndex)

children.name: clusterReduce
children.description: Reduce clusters in GeoJSON Features, similar to Array.reduce()

returns.desc: The value that results from the reduction.

params.Description: GeoJSON property key/value used to create clusters
a method that takes (previousValue, cluster, clusterValue, currentIndex)
Value to use as the first argument to the first call of the callback.

children.name: collectionOf
children.description: Enforce expectations about types of FeatureCollection inputs for Turf. Internally this uses geojsonType to judge geometry types.

params.Description: a FeatureCollection for which features will be judged

throws.desc: if value is not the expected type.

children.name: containsNumber
children.description: Checks if coordinates contains a number

returns.desc: true if Array contains a number

children.name: geojsonType
children.description: Enforce expectations about types of GeoJSON objects for Turf.

throws.desc: if value is not the expected type.

children.name: featureOf
children.description: Enforce expectations about types of Feature inputs for Turf. Internally this uses geojsonType to judge geometry types.

params.Description: a feature with an expected geometry type

throws.desc: error if value is not the expected type.

children.name: booleanClockwise
children.description: Takes a ring and return true or false whether or not the ring is clockwise or counter-clockwise.

children.name: booleanConcave
children.description: Takes a polygon and return true or false as to whether it is concave or not.

children.name: booleanContains
children.description:
Boolean-contains returns True if the second geometry is completely contained by the first geometry.
The interiors of both geometries must intersect and, the interior and boundary of the secondary (geometry b)
must not intersect the exterior of the primary (geometry a).
Boolean-contains returns the exact opposite result of the  @turf/boolean-within.

children.name: booleanCrosses
children.description:
Boolean-Crosses returns True if the intersection results in a geometry whose dimension is one less than
the maximum dimension of the two source geometries and the intersection set is interior to
both source geometries.

children.name: booleanDisjoint
children.description: Boolean-disjoint returns (TRUE) if the intersection of the two geometries is an empty set.

children.name: booleanEqual
children.description:
Determine whether two geometries of the same type have identical X,Y coordinate values.
See  http://edndoc.esri.com/arcsde/9.0/general_topics/understand_spatial_relations.htm

returns.desc: true if the objects are equal, false otherwise

children.name: booleanIntersects
children.description: Boolean-intersects returns (TRUE) two geometries intersect.

children.name: booleanOverlap
children.description:
Compares two geometries of the same dimension and returns true if their intersection set results in a geometry
different from both but of the same dimension. It applies to Polygon/Polygon, LineString/LineString,
Multipoint/Multipoint, MultiLineString/MultiLineString and MultiPolygon/MultiPolygon.
In other words, it returns true if the two geometries overlap, provided that neither completely contains the other.

params.Type: (Geometry|Feature <(LineString|MultiLineString|Polygon|MultiPolygon)>)
(Geometry|Feature <(LineString|MultiLineString|Polygon|MultiPolygon)>)

children.name: booleanParallel
children.description: Boolean-Parallel returns True if each segment of  line1  is parallel to the correspondent segment of  line2

returns.desc: true/false if the lines are parallel

children.name: booleanPointInPolygon
children.description: Takes a Point and a Polygon or MultiPolygon and determines if the point resides inside the polygon. The polygon can be convex or concave. The function accounts for holes.

returns.desc: true  if the Point is inside the Polygon;  false  if the Point is not inside the Polygon

options.Description:
True if polygon boundary should be ignored when determining if
the point is inside the polygon otherwise false.

children.name: booleanPointOnLine
children.description:
Returns true if a point is on a line. Accepts a optional parameter to ignore the
start and end vertices of the linestring.

options.Description: whether to ignore the start and end vertices.
Fractional number to compare with the cross product result. Useful for dealing with floating points such as lng/lat points

children.name: booleanWithin
children.description:
Boolean-within returns true if the first geometry is completely within the second geometry.
The interiors of both geometries must intersect and, the interior and boundary of the primary (geometry a)
must not intersect the exterior of the secondary (geometry b).
Boolean-within returns the exact opposite result of the  @turf/boolean-contains.

children.name: bearingToAzimuth
children.description:
Converts any bearing angle from the north line direction (positive clockwise)
and returns an angle between 0-360 degrees (positive clockwise), 0 being the north line

children.name: convertArea
children.description:
Converts a area to the requested unit.
Valid units: kilometers, kilometres, meters, metres, centimetres, millimeters, acres, miles, yards, feet, inches, hectares

children.name: convertLength
children.description:
Converts a length to the requested unit.
Valid units: miles, nauticalmiles, inches, yards, meters, metres, kilometers, centimeters, feet

children.name: degreesToRadians
children.description: Converts an angle in degrees to radians

children.name: lengthToRadians
children.description:
Convert a distance measurement (assuming a spherical Earth) from a real-world unit into radians
Valid units: miles, nauticalmiles, inches, yards, meters, metres, kilometers, centimeters, feet

params.Description:
can be degrees, radians, miles, inches, yards, metres,
meters, kilometres, kilometers.

children.name: lengthToDegrees
children.description:
Convert a distance measurement (assuming a spherical Earth) from a real-world unit into degrees
Valid units: miles, nauticalmiles, inches, yards, meters, metres, centimeters, kilometres, feet

params.Description:
can be degrees, radians, miles, inches, yards, metres,
meters, kilometres, kilometers.

children.name: radiansToLength
children.description:
Convert a distance measurement (assuming a spherical Earth) from radians to a more friendly unit.
Valid units: miles, nauticalmiles, inches, yards, meters, metres, kilometers, centimeters, feet

params.Description:
can be degrees, radians, miles, inches, yards, metres,
meters, kilometres, kilometers.

children.name: radiansToDegrees
children.description: Converts an angle in radians to degrees

children.name: toMercator
children.description: Converts a WGS84 GeoJSON object into Mercator (EPSG:900913) projection
children.snippet:
var pt = turf.point([-71,41]);
var converted = turf.toMercator(pt);

options.Description: allows GeoJSON input to be mutated (significant performance increase if true)

children.name: toWgs84
children.description: Converts a Mercator (EPSG:900913) GeoJSON object into WGS84 projection
children.snippet:
var pt = turf.point([-7903683.846322424, 5012341.663847514]);
var converted = turf.toWgs84(pt);

options.Description: allows GeoJSON input to be mutated (significant performance increase if true)
